meanings.definition: To type on a keyboard again.
meanings.sent1: I need to rekeyboard my essay because I made a mistake.
meanings.sent2: After fixing the error, I rekeyboarded the entire document.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally deleted my work, so now I have to rekeyboard everything.
meanings.sent4: She had to rekeyboard her notes after the computer crashed.
meanings.sent5: The student had to rekeyboard the assignment to correct the errors.

meanings.definition: A keyboard that has been used before and is being used again.
meanings.sent1: I found an old rekeyboard in the storage room.
meanings.sent2: The rekeyboard was dusty but still functional.
meanings.sent3: The rekeyboard from the basement is missing some keys.
meanings.sent4: He preferred using the rekeyboard from his previous job.
meanings.sent5: The rekeyboard on my desk is a bit worn out but works fine.
